Class Ping

  • java.lang.Object
    • Ping

  • public class Ping
extends java.lang.Object
    The Ping class is intended for a single ultrasonic ping with a single or multiple returns. The idea is that it’s going to be in an array. Each ping has a Position and cm, which gives x and y. There is also a static method public static void correct(final ArrayList pings, final Odometer odometer) throws Exception which does most of the work in localisation. This in turn calls private static void straightishLine(final ArrayList pings, final int about) twice, one for the y-axis and one for the x-axis. correct draws a straightishLine though the x and y axes (thus it will not be confused when a block is placed against the side.) It then fits it using the covariances and the variance of each of the axes and determines the coödinaties and updates the Odometer. Basically.

    this is a struct to store ultrasonic sonar information, we want this to be as small as possible since we're potentally storing a lot of them

    also does the details of localisiation

    Author:
    Neil

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void correct(java.util.ArrayList<Ping> pings, Odometer odometer)
      corrects the odometer heading and distances based on pings from localisation; assumes (1) the robot is placed in a corner, the new (x ,y) will be aligned with the corner; (2) the thing with the smallest distance are the walls (could fix this, but we're gaurateed this;) (3) the pings has sufficent pings to be useful (linear regression is taken of the two sides, so we'll need at least four pings; realistically more)
      (package private) int getCm()
      getters for logging
      (package private) Position getPosition()
      getters for logging
      private static void straightishLine(java.util.ArrayList<Ping> pings, int about)
      given an array of pings and an index, sets [rangeLower, rangeHigher] to be anything that sort of looks like a stright line (within CUTOFF_ANGLE) about that point

      • correct

        public static void correct(java.util.ArrayList<Ping> pings,
           Odometer odometer)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        corrects the odometer heading and distances based on pings from localisation; assumes (1) the robot is placed in a corner, the new (x ,y) will be aligned with the corner; (2) the thing with the smallest distance are the walls (could fix this, but we're gaurateed this;) (3) the pings has sufficent pings to be useful (linear regression is taken of the two sides, so we'll need at least four pings; realistically more)
        Parameters:
        pings - an ArrayList of pings
        odometer - an odometer to correct
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the odometer is null (no longer)
        java.lang.Exception - failed to localise

      • straightishLine

        private static void straightishLine(java.util.ArrayList<Ping> pings,
                   int about)
        given an array of pings and an index, sets [rangeLower, rangeHigher] to be anything that sort of looks like a stright line (within CUTOFF_ANGLE) about that point

        this was determined to be worse than blind picking the middle in some cases but gets rid of objects on the walls

        Parameters:
        pings - list of pings
        about - an index into pings
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the about is not an index
